data.title: [WelcomeUX] Scrollbar is not a good thing for playaround sometimes
data.body:
Testing #18091

Take snippet as example

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 49 42 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22161222/4e63b53c-defe-11e6-8854-8385a18a5627.png)

Before users type `try`, we can see five lines with an ending line `end`. After users insert the snippet

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 49 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22161248/645a54e0-defe-11e6-9c7f-c8f036190e3c.png)

The ending line `end` is missing, which makes it somehow useless. Scrollbar is the catch.

data.title: [WelcomeUX]  Go To Definition opens a new tab
data.body:
Testing #18091

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 48 23 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22161145/fe709054-defd-11e6-96c9-81d8055a0618.png)

While we don't have issues with other intellisense action like Rename or Find references.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Why is the editor walkthrough background color fixed?
data.body:
Testing #18091

On the red theme is should be a red background:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22161091/afcbbf78-defd-11e6-9498-5b962fbf0937.png)

This could make the text look awkward/inconsistent on some themes (which could easily be set on welcome page before going to walkthrough).

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Not sure what I did but CSS color swatches disappeared
data.body:
Testing #18091

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22161063/8195a740-defd-11e6-8930-0da377554320.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Rename example isn't "play-friendly"
data.body:
Testing #18091

When we give someone a hammer (the rename shortcut), we should expect them to now think that everything is a nail. In the example below, I would expect the jsdoc parameter to also be renamed when I rename the parameter, but that is not the case. We should either make this work in the language service or provide a different example (perhaps one where the function parameters are actually used)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22160953/e9659ade-defc-11e6-862b-4967309bf625.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Walkthrough gives bad keybinding advice on some platforms
data.body:
Testing #18091

In Ubuntu/Unity, ctrl+shift+alt+up/down moves the foreground application to another desktop. We need to be more platform aware as several keybindings don't work on Linux.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22160913/bd23fd62-defc-11e6-98e5-7d5d9a158b3c.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Add empty spaces in editors for ppl to play around in Walk-Through
data.body:
Testing #18091 

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 37 47 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22160876/8179687e-defc-11e6-8e78-138ba552ac71.png)

If ppl want to play with this feature, he/she has to move the cursor to the end of the third line, press enter and then type. A better way is add an empty line at the end of the editor and put cursor there, then ppl can directly type and play.

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 40 57 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22160964/f51152ce-defc-11e6-8631-a23052338432.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Emmet cheat sheet URL is wrong
data.body:
Testing #18091

http://http//docs.emmet.io/cheat-sheet/ is giving me:

> This site can’t be reached
>
> http’s server DNS address could not be found.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Editor height in Walk-Through

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #18091 

Add new lines to any editor in the Walk-Through, we don't adjust the height the editor, instead we use scrollbar. 

However if you go the Welcome page and click Interactive Playground again, we restore what's in that particular editor with full height

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 10 36 22 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22160841/4f5d67b4-defc-11e6-996b-eb25a10e5509.png)

Reload the window will flush the content and everything is back to normal.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Why are the embedded editors using rounded selections when I don't have that set
data.body:
Testing #18091 

I have this in my settings.json `"editor.roundedSelection": false,` but the editors still have rounded edges?

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Editor walkthrough errors pollute workspace problems view
data.body:
Testing #18091

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22160748/e446f918-defb-11e6-90d6-d516dad0d7c3.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] The bottom 50% of the bottom embedded editor lines cannot be clicked
data.body:
Testing #18091

I cannot click on the last half of the #p3 line in the first editor.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Pressing ESC should hide the overlay
data.body:
Testing #18091

It requires a click right now.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Change default keyboard shortcuts button wording could use some work
data.body:
Testing #18091

I was under the impression it was going to open keybindings.json. How about something like "Use/Load Another Editor's Keybindings"?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22160491/957ad5a8-defa-11e6-929d-1747cc114ce2.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Scrollbars don't disappear after undoing all text changes
data.body:
Testing #18091

Type a bunch of text and new lines to make scrollbars appear
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22160432/45e707be-defa-11e6-844c-434f42a8dd39.png)

After undoing  changes, scrollbars will remain in place even though content fits fine
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22160498/a15f57f4-defa-11e6-982d-bc03efeb5061.png)

This also happens in the normal editor, but is more of an issue when you have limited space to work with.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] command palette and sidebar behavior inconsistent in interface overview
data.body:
Testing #18091

It might not be a valid issue, I just find it annoying. In Interface Overview, pressing `ctrl+shift+p` will launch the command palette under the overlay, and I can still type in the palette. While if I want to play around with the sidebar, I have click twice, the first one dismiss the overlay and the second one does the trigger.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Scrollbar temporarily can't scroll up in editor walkthrough
data.body:

1. Scroll to the very top of the page

2. Click one of the options below to visit the relative link
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22160110/d00f1d16-def8-11e6-88cf-fb7604396a98.png)

3. Navigation succeeds, but in order to scroll back up, you must first scroll down
